page.title: 03Coltishall children (2 of 2)
page.content:
Some of the differences we noticed when we delivered the questionnaire was that the school was much smaller than ours, the buildings were older and that their headmaster was a teacher as well!
We decided that the children of {Coltishall}were worse off than us in quite a lot of ways. They had no entertainment even nearby, like we have in the city. They have no First Division Team to follow, the shops are poor compared to Norwich, especially there are no computer shops. The main hospital is in the city.
There were some advantages; the scenery, healthy air and open countryside.
